reasoning_log.comment: The agent's forward direction (N) is blocked by a wall, so moving East is the safest option as the adjacent cell to the East is free. This move avoids backtracking and progresses safely without collisions.

The agent senses the goal bearing to the East and the adjacent cell to the East is free to move. Moving East follows the goal direction and avoids walls and backtracking, maximizing progress toward the goal safely.
The goal sensor indicates the goal is east and far, and there are no visible obstacles or agents blocking the way east. Moving east is safe and aligned with maximizing progress toward the goal.

The agent is at the grid edge with walls to the north and east, and out of bounds to the west. The only free adjacent cell is to the south, so moving south is the safest valid action. Recent positions indicate no backtracking issue, and the goal bearing is northeast but movement is limited now.

Moving East is the best choice because the goal sensor indicates the goal bearing is East and the East cell is free for movement. Walls block North and South, and West is free but not aligned with the goal bearing, so moving East maximizes progress toward the goal.

All adjacent cells are free and the previous move was east, so moving east again avoids backtracking and progresses the team towards the goal. There are no obstacles or agents blocking the way east.

Given the goal sensor shows the goal bearing east and the agent cannot move west (out of bounds), moving south is a safe choice avoiding backtracking and progressing in open space. This move also keeps the agent away from walls and potential collisions.
